sentence.idiomatic: What's the matter? I don't feel well.
What's wrong with him? He doesn't feel well.
What's the matter, you guys? We don't feel well.
Where do you not feel well? I have a headache.
Where do you not feel well? I have a sore throat.
Where do you not feel well? I have a cold.
Does he have a sore throat too? His throat isn't sore.
Do you have a headache? I don't have a headache.
I have a headache, and a sore throat. How about you? I have a headache, but my throat isn't sore.
Did you catch a cold? I didn't catch a cold.
Did you catch a cold? I got the flu.
Did you catch a cold? Yeah, and I have a fever too.
Have you taken medicine? Yes.
Have you taken medicine? No.
Have you taken medicine? I don't want to take medicine.
I have a lot of medicine here.
I don't have headache medicine here.
Do you have medicine there? No.
I have both Chinese medicine and Western medicine.
I don't have either Chinese medicine or Western medicine.
Do you have both Chinese medicine and Western medicine? Yes.
I'll give you some medicine.
I'll give you some water.
I'll give you some time.
What's wrong with you? Where do you feel uncomfortable?
I have a headache and a sore throat. I have a cold.
Have you taken any medicine?
I have, but it doesn't work.
I've got a lot of cold medicine here, both Chinese and Western medicine. I'll give you some.
Thank you so much.
